lines.text: Look. If you don't like my act, why don't you get out of here.
Like it? Why, you're the hit of the show.
It's one of the funniest acts I ever saw.
You know very well it wasn't, nobody else was laughing.
But there was two pianos. And that suit. What could you expect?
It's all right if you can stand the noise.
Someday, I'll write a song. And she'll come begging to sing it.

[to Paul]
You're going to theological school tomorrow - and you're going in "that suit!"
Funny thing about geniuses. You always hear of them burning in an attic. But you always see them burning in the brightest places in town.
No matter what you think, he's just as serious about his work as he ever was. Why, he has a wonderful melody, and he wants to put words to it. It's an idea about his home on the banks of the Wabash.

[snorts]
"Banks of the Wabash." Farm stuff. Who cares anything about farms? Who ever heard of the Wabash? But if it's a good tune, we might change it to the Hudson.
[after tearing up Sally Elliot's wardrobe with a pair of scissors, Paul Dresser is arrested and thrown in jail]
